description: The cause of CVE-2023-4863 is rooted in a heap buffer overflow vulnerability within the WebP image format handling in the Chromium open-source software. This flaw can allow a remote attacker to exploit the vulnerability to execute arbitrary code or crash the browser. It specifically affects Microsoft Edge, which is based on Chromium and incorporates this component. The vulnerability is particularly severe given that it has been publicly disclosed and was confirmed to be exploited in the wild. To mitigate this issue, users are advised to update to the latest versions of affected products, including Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) version 116.0.1938.81 and any associated updates referenced in KB article ID KB-116.0.1938.81.
